snippet: The largest faction of Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda’s Democratic Party objected to a proposed tax increase.
abstract: Unpopular government of Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda of Japan suffers another setback when the largest faction of his Democratic Party quits over a proposal to double the national tax to 2015, leaving the party barely in control of Parliament’s lower house.
lead_paragraph: The largest faction of Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda’s Democratic Party objected to a proposed tax increase.

headline.seo: Japanese Prime Minister Faces Setback on Tax Increase
headline.main: Japan’s Leader Is Set Back as a Faction of His Party Quits
headline.print_headline: Japan’s Leader Is Set Back as a Faction of His Party Quits
